thread.title: Ground News - Leap year birthday holds special meaning for family of twin boys
thread.title_full: Ground News - Leap year birthday holds special meaning for family of twin boys

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Leap year birthday holds special meaning for family of twin boys
text: Leap year , occurring every four years, adds an extra day to the calendar to sync with Earth's orbit, as explained by Dylan's mother. - A leap year baby named Corbin Schindle, born on Feb. 29, 12 years ago, plans to celebrate by getting an ice cream cake with his family. - Families of leap year babies adjust celebrations based on non-leap years, with some opting for a dinner on Feb. 28, as shared by Standahl's mother. 58 Articles 58 Articles [CBC News 13 hours ago·CanadaRead Full Article] This leap-year Londoner is celebrating his 3rd birthday today When you're a leap year baby, you have to have a good sense of humour and get ready for some jokes. Take it from Kolton Emigh, the sixth-grader who is officially turning three today, though he's been alive for 12 years. [KIFI 4 hours ago·Idaho Falls, United StatesRead Full Article] By Shawn Chitnis Click here for updates on this story OAKLAND, California (KPIX) — The Erickson family of Oakland looks forward to Feb. 29 every four years with joy and gratitude thanks to the special meaning it holds in their lives. Their twin boys were born 11 minutes apart, one arriving in the final minutes of Feb. 28, 2016, and the other in the first minutes of Leap Day. “Mornings are chaos as you might imagine with three boys,” said Su… [Het Laatste Nieuws 14 hours ago·Kobbegem, BelgiumRead Full Article] Finally, February 29: This is how the leap babies celebrate their birthdays This year is a leap year. Today, a special party is being held at various locations in Flanders. The so-called “leap babies” can celebrate their real birthday again today. We took a look at the birthdays.
